metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8817 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
QEMU (aka Quick Emulator) built to use 'address_space_translate' to map an address to a MemoryRegionSection is vulnerable to an OOB r/w access issue. It could occur while doing pci_dma_read/write calls. Affects QEMU versions >= 1.6.0 and <= 2.3.1. A privileged user inside guest could use this flaw to crash the guest instance resulting in DoS.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8817` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-kvm - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-system - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-system-aarch64 - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-system-common - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-user - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-user-static - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-utils - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> 1.6.0 to 2.3.1 list of commits may be incomplete, see https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/qemu-stable/2016-01/msg00065.html we will not be releasing an update for this this issue.

criterions.comment: qemu package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4').
